worklogs.comment:
liyafan82 commented on pull request #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073
 
 
   Two improvements:
   
   Compare the whole range of the data buffer, instead of comparing individual elements.
   If two elements are of different sizes, there is no need to compare them.

tianchen92 commented on pull request #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#discussion_r313219146
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java
 ##########
 @@ -183,21 +204,14 @@ protected boolean compareBaseVariableWidthVectors(BaseVariableWidthVector left)
         return false;
       }
 
-      int offsetWidth = BaseVariableWidthVector.OFFSET_WIDTH;
-
-      if (!isNull) {
 
 Review comment:
   Should we keep this branch since there's no need to compare value length if isNull？

praveenbingo commented on pull request #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#discussion_r313285338
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java
 ##########
 @@ -174,6 +174,27 @@ protected boolean compareBaseVariableWidthVectors(BaseVariableWidthVector left)
       return false;
     }
 
+    final int offsetWidth = BaseVariableWidthVector.OFFSET_WIDTH;
 
 Review comment:
   better would be two things
   
   1. fast path if value count == length - that does memcmp on all three buffers
   2. use memcmp on valid lengths.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#issuecomment-520857912
 
 
   @pravindra the [spec shows](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/Layout.html#list-type) nulls take zero length.  I thought there were words to that effect at one point, but couldn't find them on a quick search, so maybe this was changed and the example wasn't updated.

liyafan82 commented on pull request #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#discussion_r313698134
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java
 ##########
 @@ -174,6 +174,27 @@ protected boolean compareBaseVariableWidthVectors(BaseVariableWidthVector left)
       return false;
     }
 
+    final int offsetWidth = BaseVariableWidthVector.OFFSET_WIDTH;
 
 Review comment:
   thanks for you comments.
   It seems we cannot compare offset buffers directly, because the vector range may start from different positions.
   
   For example, we compare (1, 3) of vector 1 with (2, 4) of vector 2. Their offset buffers cannot be equal, although their content can be equal.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

liyafan82 commented on issue #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#issuecomment-521096528
 
 
   @praveenbingo @pravindra @emkornfield thanks for the information. 
   I did not expect that a null value could hold a memory region in the data buffer. 
   
   I think this should be made clear, because otherwise it may cause unexpected problems in the user code.

emkornfield commented on issue #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#issuecomment-523284011
 
 
   I think the question at hand is whether null lists/strings always have zero
   size.  If they do then this shouldn't be a concern.
   
   On Mon, Aug 19, 2019 at 7:15 AM François Saint-Jacques <
   notifications@github.com> wrote:
   
   > *@fsaintjacques* commented on this pull request.
   > ------------------------------
   >
   > In
   > java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java
   > <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#discussion_r315233405>:
   >
   > > @@ -174,6 +174,27 @@ protected boolean compareBaseVariableWidthVectors(BaseVariableWidthVector left)
   >        return false;
   >      }
   >
   > +    final int offsetWidth = BaseVariableWidthVector.OFFSET_WIDTH;
   > +
   > +    // compare data buffers to make sure they have identical content
   > +    final int leftDataStart = left.getOffsetBuffer().getInt(leftStart * offsetWidth);
   > +    final int leftDataEnd = left.getOffsetBuffer().getInt((leftStart + length) * offsetWidth);
   > +    final int rightDataStart = right.getOffsetBuffer().getInt(rightStart * offsetWidth);
   > +    final int rightDataEnd = right.getOffsetBuffer().getInt((rightStart + length) * offsetWidth);
   > +
   > +    // check total length
   > +    if (rightDataEnd - rightDataStart != leftDataEnd - leftDataStart) {
   > +      return false;
   > +    }
   > +
   > +    int result = ByteFunctionHelpers.equal(left.getDataBuffer(), leftDataStart, leftDataEnd,
   >
   > If the data comes from a mmap buffer from C++/C, it can be uninitialized
   > memory and no assumption should be made about the content.
   >
   > —
   > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
   > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

liyafan82 commented on issue #5073: ARROW-6221: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#issuecomment-523291377
 
 
   > I think the question at hand is whether null lists/strings always have zero size. If they do then this shouldn't be a concern.
   > […](#)
   > On Mon, Aug 19, 2019 at 7:15 AM François Saint-Jacques < ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java <[#5073 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5073#discussion_r315233405)>: > @@ -174,6 +174,27 @@ protected boolean compareBaseVariableWidthVectors(BaseVariableWidthVector left) return false; } + final int offsetWidth = BaseVariableWidthVector.OFFSET_WIDTH; + + // compare data buffers to make sure they have identical content + final int leftDataStart = left.getOffsetBuffer().getInt(leftStart * offsetWidth); + final int leftDataEnd = left.getOffsetBuffer().getInt((leftStart + length) * offsetWidth); + final int rightDataStart = right.getOffsetBuffer().getInt(rightStart * offsetWidth); + final int rightDataEnd = right.getOffsetBuffer().getInt((rightStart + length) * offsetWidth); + + // check total length + if (rightDataEnd - rightDataStart != leftDataEnd - leftDataStart) { + return false; + } + + int result = ByteFunctionHelpers.equal(left.getDataBuffer(), leftDataStart, leftDataEnd, If the data comes from a mmap buffer from C++/C, it can be uninitialized memory and no assumption should be made about the content. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#5073?email_source=notifications&email_token=AEIKYDXHZKEKMSFPSLFJEKLQFKTGJA5CNFSM4ILHBILKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFWFIHK3DMKJSXC5LFON2FEZLWNFSXPKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOCB6GNCA#discussion_r315233405>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEIKYDW3TQSSV52IX35IJPTQFKTGJANCNFSM4ILHBILA> .
   
   @emkornfield You are right.
   This is a very important question. If the varchar/varbinary's null values has non-empty space in the data buffer, and the contents of the non-empty spaces are undefined, I think some client code may crash. 
   So making this question clear is more important than this particular PR.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Two improvements:
 # Compare the whole range of the data buffer, instead of comparing individual elements.
 # If two elements are of different sizes, there is no need to compare them.
fields.summary: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors

comments.body:
According to the discussion in https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8de66a11b0256d2c81aa767f9ad3b4501829707bf16fb80bbb927f72@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E
The code in the PR is not applicable. So we close it.
